messages.content:
Let me clarify the structure:

  At ERP-ODOO-FORK root:
  .coditect/    (actual directory - git submodule)
  .claude -> .coditect  (symlink)

  Inside .coditect/ (the directory has internal symlinks):
  .claude -> .coditect
  .coditect -> ../../.coditect

  So .coditect is the actual directory (git submodule with CODITECT
  framework), and .claude is a symlink pointing to it.

  This is the correct setup for Claude Code - it looks for .claude/, and the
   symlink redirects to the CODITECT framework in .coditect/.

  The internal symlinks inside .coditect/ are part of the CODITECT
  submodule's own structure (pointing to parent repos).

> so everything is setup correctly.

messages.content:
Now I see the issue. Both are separate git submodules pointing to the same
   repo:

  /Users/halcasteel/PROJECTS/
  ├── .coditect/                    # Submodule ->
  coditect-project-dot-claude.git
  └── ERP-ODOO-FORK/
      └── .coditect/                # Submodule ->
  coditect-project-dot-claude.git (DUPLICATE)

  Both submodules point to
  https://github.com/coditect-ai/coditect-project-dot-claude.git

  The internal symlink .coditect -> ../../.coditect inside the submodule is
  trying to reference the parent, but since they're duplicates, it's
  redundant.

  You're right - this seems wrong. It would be cleaner if:
  ERP-ODOO-FORK/.coditect -> ../../.coditect  (symlink to parent, not
  separate submodule)

  Do you want me to convert ERP-ODOO-FORK/.coditect from a submodule to a
  symlink pointing to the parent?

> we should really think through this so that we have a consistent approach 
so that every sub-project in the PROJECTS folder will have sym link to the 
coditect-project-dot-claude.git and from there we well be creating a .claude
 in every sub-project and each of their submodules and submodules of 
submodules so that CODITECT is the brain of every project and its 
submodules, the code of every submodule is associated and pushed and pulled 
from the submodule git changes in any context are specific to the submodule 
in which the changes take place and the git tracks those changes and backs 
up. each submodule should have its own project plan and task checklist with 
checkboxes and then (submodules are subprojects of the parent project and 
the parent projects live in the PROJECTS directory. distributed intelligence
 with the same CODITECT brain and /export files all get moved to the same 
MEMORY-CONTEXT for processing by the /expert-dedup slash command where the 
contexts are deduped to the unique messages stored so that we do not lose 
any context over the lifetime of the individuals CODITECT usuage over time. 
which prevents CATASTROPHIC FORGETTING caused by context compactions, the 
/export files must be captured and backup before compaction events.

messages.content:
This is a critical architectural decision. Let me think through this
  systematically and create a proper design.
messages.content_preview:
This is a critical architectural decision. Let me think through this
  systematically and create a proper design.

messages.content:
CODITECT Distributed Architecture Design

  Core Principles

  1. Single Brain: One coditect-project-dot-claude.git submodule at PROJECTS
   root
  2. Distributed Access: Symlinks from every project/submodule to the shared
   brain
  3. Local Context: Each project gets its own .claude/ with PROJECT-PLAN and
   TASKLIST
  4. Git Isolation: Each submodule tracks its own changes
  5. Centralized Memory: All /export files to one MEMORY-CONTEXT for
  deduplication
  6. Zero Catastrophic Forgetting: Every unique message preserved forever

  Proposed Structure

  PROJECTS/
  ├── .coditect/                        # Git submodule (THE BRAIN)
  │   └── [coditect-project-dot-claude contents]
  │
  ├── MEMORY-CONTEXT/                   # CENTRAL memory for ALL projects
  │   ├── dedup_state/                  # Global deduplication tracking
  │   ├── exports-archive/              # All archived exports
  │   └── sessions/                     # Session continuity
  │
  ├── ERP-ODOO-FORK/                    # Project 1
  │   ├── .coditect -> ../.coditect     # SYMLINK to brain (not submodule!)
  │   ├── .claude/                      # LOCAL project config
  │   │   ├── CLAUDE.md                 # Project-specific instructions
  │   │   ├── PROJECT-PLAN.md           # Project plan with phases
  │   │   └── TASKLIST.md               # Task checklist with checkboxes
  │   │
  │   └── odoo-addons/                  # Submodule of ERP-ODOO-FORK
  │       ├── .coditect -> ../../.coditect  # SYMLINK to brain
  │       └── .claude/                      # Submodule-specific config
  │           ├── CLAUDE.md
  │           ├── PROJECT-PLAN.md
  │           └── TASKLIST.md
  │
  ├── Project-2/                        # Project 2
  │   ├── .coditect -> ../.coditect     # SYMLINK to brain
  │   └── .claude/                      # Local config
  │
  └── coditect-rollout-master/          # CODITECT development project
      └── submodules/
          └── coditect-project-dot-claude/  # Source repo for THE BRAIN

  Key Differences from Current Setup

  | Aspect                | Current (Wrong)                    | Proposed
  (Correct)                 |
  |-----------------------|------------------------------------|------------
  ------------------------|
  | .coditect in projects | Separate git submodule (duplicate) | Symlink to
  PROJECTS/.coditect      |
  | .claude               | Symlink to .coditect               | Actual
  directory with local config |
  | MEMORY-CONTEXT        | Per-project                        | Centralized
   at PROJECTS level      |
  | Brain copies          | Multiple (one per project)         | One (shared
   via symlinks)          |

  How It Works

  1. Claude Code looks for .claude/CLAUDE.md
  2. .claude/CLAUDE.md contains project-specific instructions + references
  to .coditect/
  3. .coditect symlink provides access to shared agents, commands, skills
  4. /export files get moved to PROJECTS/MEMORY-CONTEXT/
  5. export-dedup.py processes all exports into global dedup store

  Benefits

  - Single source of truth: Update CODITECT once, all projects get it
  - No duplicate submodules: Cleaner git history
  - Project isolation: Each project has its own plans and tasks
  - Centralized memory: All context in one place for deduplication
  - Scalable: Works for any depth of submodules

  ---
  Do you want me to:
  1. Create a detailed implementation document with exact commands?
  2. Start fixing ERP-ODOO-FORK to match this architecture?
  3. Both?

> yes but it should have its own submodule below the coditect-rollout-main 
create a new directory as a proper submodule as a new github repo, set that 
directory as a repository for the research, analysis, dececisions, sdd, tdd 
adrs with its own README.md CLAUDE.md and symlinks for keeping this 
architectural design decision as an independent tracking of the decisions 
and architecture for this critical element and CODITECT design and 
architecture decision.

  2. Distributed Access: Symlinks from every project/s...

messages.content:
Interrupted · What should Claude do instead?
> I thought the .claude and ,coditect are symlinks yes?
messages.content_preview:
Interrupted · What should Claude do instead?
> I thought the .claude and ,coditect are symlinks yes?

messages.content:
Let me clarify the architecture. There are two possible designs:

  Option A: Both symlinks (what you may be expecting)
  .coditect -> ../.coditect     # Symlink to brain
  .claude -> .coditect          # Symlink to local .coditect
  - All projects share same CLAUDE.md from brain
  - No project-specific instructions

  Option B: .coditect symlink, .claude directory (what I proposed in ADR)
  .coditect -> ../.coditect     # Symlink to brain
  .claude/                      # Actual directory
    └── CLAUDE.md               # Project-specific instructions
  - Each project has its own CLAUDE.md
  - Shared resources via .coditect/

  The question is: Where should project-specific configuration (like "this
  is a CRM project with these plans") live?

  If .claude is a symlink to .coditect, every project gets the same generic
  CODITECT instructions. If .claude is a directory, each project can have
  tailored instructions.

  Which approach do you want?
  - Both symlinks: Simpler, all projects identical
  - .claude as directory: Each project has custom CLAUDE.md that references
  shared brain

> it would be good that the .claude can have individual instructions but 
they need to get all of the agents etc from .coditect
messages.content_preview:

  Option A: Both symlinks (what you may be expecting)
  .coditect -> ../.coditect     # Symlink to brain
  .claude -> .coditect       ...

messages.content:
Exactly - that's the architecture I proposed:

  .coditect -> ../.coditect     # Symlink to shared brain (agents, commands,
   skills)
  .claude/                      # Actual directory
    └── CLAUDE.md               # Project-specific instructions

  The .claude/CLAUDE.md references .coditect/ for shared resources:
  # My Project

  ## Shared Resources (from .coditect/)
  - Agents: `.coditect/agents/`
  - Commands: `.coditect/commands/`
  - Skills: `.coditect/skills/`

  ## Project-Specific Instructions
  [Custom context for this project]

  Now let me launch research agents to validate this architecture with best
  practices:
